content.webTitle: Chelsea v Sheffield United: match preview

fields.headline: Chelsea v Sheffield United: match preview
fields.bodyText: Chelsea will not underestimate Sheffield United given that Chris Wilder’s side took four points from them last season. This could be tricky, especially as Christian Pulisic and Kai Havertz are unavailable. Yet Chelsea have won their past three games and have five successive clean sheets in all competitions. It would be a shock were United, who have one point from seven games, to end their wait for a first league win. Jacob Steinberg Saturday 5.30pm Sky Sports Premier League Venue Stamford Bridge Last season Chelsea 2 Sheffield United 2 Odds H 2-5 A 7-1 D 4-1 Referee Jon Moss This season G4 Y16 R0 4 cards/game CHELSEA Subs from Caballero, Arrizabalaga, Emerson, Alonso, Azpilicueta, Christensen, Rüdiger, Tomori, Kovacic, Giroud, Hudson-Odoi Doubtful None Injured Gilmour (knee, 21 Nov), Havertz (coronavirus, 21 Nov), Pulisic (hamstring, 21 Nov) Suspended None Discipline Y7 R1 Form LDWDDW Leading scorers Jorginho, Werner 3 SHEFFIELD UNITED Subs from Verrips, Foderingham, Bogle, McGoldrick, Lundstram, Rodwell, Sharp, Jagielka, Burke Doubtful None Injured Fleck (back, 28 Nov), Mousset (ankle, Dec), O’Connell (knee, unknown) Suspended None Unavailable Ampadu (loan terms) Discipline Y9 R1 Form LLLDLL Leading scorers Berge, McGoldrick, Sharp 1
